raw_text:
New Harry Potter tops book chart
 
 Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince has topped Amazon's book chart less than 24 hours after its release date - 16 July - was announced.
 
 Thousands of customers placed pre-orders on the amazon.co.uk website for the sixth book in the series. Rowling revealed she had completed the novel on Tuesday, ahead of the scheduled announcement on 25 December. It will be published simultaneously in the UK, the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and South Africa. JK Rowling's fifth book in the wizard series, Harry Potter and Order of the Phoenix was Amazon's largest pre-ordered item ever, with 420,000 copies pre-ordered prior to its release in June 2003. Customers who pre-order Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince avoid standing in long queues at bookshops on the day of the book's release next July. "The fact that the book has already hit number one in our Hot 100 books chart shows how incredibly excited customers are about the sixth Harry Potter," said Amazon's Robin Terrell.
 
 Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince takes up the story of Harry Potter's sixth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry as Lord Voldemort grows stronger. Rowling has already revealed that the Half-Blood Prince is neither Harry nor Voldemort. And she added that the opening chapter of the book had been brewing in her mind for 13 years. Rowling said she had plenty of time while pregnant "to tinker with the manuscript to my satisfaction and I am as happy as I have ever been with the end result". She also previously revealed that a character will be killed in the sixth book, but she has given no hints as to who it might be. Following publication of the sixth book, just one novel remains to complete the series.
llama3.2:1b:
New Harry Potter book tops Amazon's chart 16 July; JK Rowling completes sixth book. 

Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is the latest in the series, published simultaneously worldwide next year. The book follows Harry's sixth year at Hogwarts as Voldemort grows stronger.

The book has already topped Amazon's Hot 100 books list and will feature a character who will be killed in the final book of the series.
llama3.2:3b: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince has topped Amazon's book chart 24 hours after its release date announcement. Thousands of customers pre-ordered the book, which will be published simultaneously in several countries. The book's excitement is evident as it reached number one on Amazon's Hot 100 books chart. Rowling revealed that the Half-Blood Prince is not Harry or Voldemort, and that a character will be killed in the sixth book.
gemma2:2b: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince topped Amazon's book chart less than 24 hours after its release. The novel pre-orders were huge and customers can avoid long lines at bookstores on release day.  The book is set in Harry's sixth year at Hogwarts, where Lord Voldemort grows stronger. Rowling revealed that the novel's title doesn't refer to either Harry or Voldemort.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is set 13 years after its release on June 25, 2004. It will hit number one on Amazon's book chart less than two hours after it was announced on July 16. More than 1 million copies of the sixth book have been pre-ordered. Customers who order Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince can avoid long queues at bookshops on August 7, 2023 (five days before the release).
qwen2.5:1.5b: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince topped Amazon's UK book chart less than 24 hours after its release on July 16th. Thousands pre-ordered over 400,000 copies; Rowling revealed her finishing date was earlier; it features Lord Voldemort growing stronger; characters will be killed off in the final novel. There are now three books left in the series.
qwen2.5:3b: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince topped Amazon's UK book chart hours after its release date was announced, with thousands pre-ordering copies. The 6th installment marks Rowling's largest pre-ordered item ever at 420,000 copies for her fifth novel in 2003. It follows Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix. The new book resumes Harry’s sixth year at Hogwarts as Voldemort strengthens. Rowling revealed it’s neither Harry nor Voldemort and the opening chapter has been brewing for 13 years. Just one more book remains to complete the series.

First sentence: "New Harry Potter tops book chart" - So the sixth book is leading on Amazon's charts after 24 hours. Got it.

Line about pre-orders: "It will be published simultaneously in... UK, US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa." So globally? That covers multiple markets.

Next line: "Amazon's largest pre-ordered item ever..." Prior to release was June 2003. Wow, that's a significant jump from three months ago. The current pre-order count is 420,000 as of the latest info provided.

Customer experience: "Avoid long queues at bookshops." This is about the customer experience when ordering new releases before physical release, which can be frustrating for some people.

Robin Terrell says: "The fact that it's number one shows excitement." That highlights how much customers are dying to get this next title. So, it's a big jump from 420k pre-ordered in June to 420k now? Or is it more than that?

Next paragraph: "Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince takes... story of sixth year at HGS as Lord Voldemort grows stronger." So the first Harry Potter books are for young readers, so this one might appeal to older fans.

Rowan adds: "She revealed half-blood prince isn't Harry or Voldemort. Chapter 1 had been in her mind for 13 years." That's interesting because she's not from Harry's side but from Rowan, the non-Wizard of wizard stuff.

She says: "Enough time during pregnancy to tinker with manuscript." So she wanted that book done just right when she was pregnant. She might have needed a lot of time for that reason.

Then: "A character will be killed in the sixth book, hints unknown." That's probably the same as before? Or does it imply something about who it is?

Finally, "Only one novel remains to complete the series," which makes sense because there are seven Harry Potter books. So if we're talking about the sixth, then one more left.

So putting it all together: The sixth Harry Potter book was a huge hit on Amazon, sold pre-ordering for a long time before release. It's set in the seventh year of Hogwarts, with Voldemort growing stronger. Lots of fan speculation and excitement. So the summary should include the book's status, its location, pre-orders, key details about the story, and what fans expect next.

I need to make sure I include all these points without adding personal opinions or explanations. Just the facts from the text.
</think>

The sixth Harry Potter book topped Amazon's charts after a week of excitement, with over 420,000 pre-orders placed by customers. It was published simultaneously in multiple markets and is set in the seventh year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry as Voldemort grows stronger. Fans were eager to see this non-Harry Potter character develop further, and the release will end fans on a high.
tinyllama:1.1b: According to Amazon's pre-order data, the sixth book in the Harry Potter series has already reached the number one spot on their Hot 100 books chart, which includes both physical and digital copies of the book. The pre-orders for the book, titled "Harry Potter and the Half-Blod Prince," were completed by thousands of customers ahead of its release in July 2023. HarperCollins announced that readers can pre-order the sixth book now, as they are eligible to do so on both physical and digital platforms. The publisher also noted that "the fact that the book has already hit number one in our Hot 100 books chart shows how excited customers are about the sixth Harry Potter." Rowling, who had previously announced she would finish writing the series by August 2022, said her mind was completely set on finishing off the story. However, no specific characters were confirmed to be killed off in the upcoming book.

With thousands of customers placing pre-orders, it remains as Amazon's largest pre-ordered item ever with 420,000 copies purchased before its release in June 2003.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, JK Rowling's latest installment in the Harry Potter series, debuted at the top of Amazon's book chart on 16 July, surpassing the pre-order records set by her previous book, Harry Potter and Order of the Phoenix. This sixth book will be published simultaneously in several countries, including the UK, US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, and South Africa. The novel picks up where the previous series left off, with Voldemort growing stronger and the storyline revolving around Harry's sixth year at Hogwarts. Rowling has hinted that a character will meet an untimely end in this book, which she has been developing since 2000. Just one more novel remains to complete the series. Customers pre-ordering the book can avoid long lines on release day next July.
